author: Reuters Editorial
title: U.S. 2-year note sells at highest yield since July 2008
text:
NEW YORK, The U.S. Treasury Department on Tuesday sold $32 billion of two-year fixed-rate debt at a yield of 2.498 percent, the highest yield at an auction of this maturity since July 2008, Treasury data showed.
The ratio of bids to the amount of two-year notes offered was 2.61, the weakest since December. This gauge on overall auction demand was 2.91 at the prior two-year auction held in March. (Reporting by Richard Leong; Editing by Dan Grebler)
